thread.title: Former Alabama DB sets up charity website for Altee Tenpenny's family
thread.title_full: Former Alabama DB sets up charity website for Altee Tenpenny's family

author: John Talty | jtalty@al.com
title: Former Alabama DB sets up charity website for Altee Tenpenny's family
text:
Comments 
John Fulton remembers Altee Tenpenny with the "biggest smile." 
So when the former Alabama defensive back heard about Altee Tenpenny's death, he decided to do something. Fulton started a GoFundMe account to help Tenpenny's family defray the costs of his funeral. Fulton and Tenpenny played one season together in 2013. It doesn't matter if it's $1, $10 or $100 anything helps. We all know Altee would have done it for us #FlyHighMyGuy #RIPAltee — John Fulton (@_Elvis_Freshley) October 22, 2015 We all knew Altee as a guy that would do anything for anybody. Well now is our chance to give back to his family https://t.co/uR0jV9x3mx — John Fulton (@_Elvis_Freshley) October 22, 2015 
As of Thursday morning, the GoFundMe had raised more than $8,000 of a $15,000 goal. You can check out the GoFundMe website and donate to the cause here . 
Tenpenny, 20, died Tuesday evening after a one-car accident outside Glen Allan, Miss. His car collided with a highway sign, went airborne and began rolling once it landed on the ground. Mississippi Highway Patrol and accident reconstruction experts are investigating the cause of the accident. 
Tenpenny played two seasons at Alabama before transferring to UNLV in May. His former Alabama teammates remember him for his big smile. 
"Big smile, dimples," said Denzell Devall with a grin of his own. "I never really saw him down. No matter what he was going through, he was always smiling, clowning. You would never know what was going on, if he was mad or not. He was just always smiling. Nick Saban expresses his condolences to Altee Tenpenny's family Nick Saban used a portion of his mid week press conference to express his condolences to Altee Tenpenny's family. Tenpenny, a former player at Alabama, died in a car wreck in Mississippi.
